intro: Sida arrabidae, commonly known as the Portuguese morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of blue and purple. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers open in the morning and close by midday, hence its common name. Sida arrabidae is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
